metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6563 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in intent handling in Google Chrome on Android prior to 85.0.4183.83 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from disk via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6563` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
